type.title: Type
type.description: The type of the identifier. It can be one of the following: event, method or variable.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the method to call. For example MIStartIn.

index.title: Index
index.description: The index number of the method to call.

accessMode.title: AccessMode
accessMode.description: The access mode (user level) when writing to a variable in the device. The default access mode 0 (zero) is always active. Higher access modes such as 1 (Operator), 2 (Maintenance), 3 (Authorized Client), or 4 (Service) all require some password, which should be listed in the manufacturer's documentation. (The numbers 5 through 7 are internal values of the manufacturer.)

password.title: Password
password.description: Only needed with an increased access mode (user level) parameter, when writing to a variable in the device.
